segments.text: I see the girl reaching out for a cookie, her face full of anticipation.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She looks so innocent, just waiting for her brother to share with her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I notice how she’s not even touching the stool, like she knows it’s dangerous.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is so focused on the jar, he doesn’t even see her standing there.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think she’s going to be disappointed if he doesn’t give her one.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is pouring out of the sink, and she doesn’t seem to care at all.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if she even realizes how much trouble they’re in.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman is just standing there, drying dishes like nothing is happening.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel like the girl is the only one who’s being careful, but it’s not enough.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The whole scene is just a mess, and no one is doing anything about it.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I hope the boy gives her a cookie before the stool tips over.
segments.speaker: PAR
